roil verb [I or T]
(TWIST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to (cause to) move quickly in a twisting circular movement: Fierce winds roiled the sea. A massive tower of smoke roiled skyward.

roil verb [I or T]
(UPSET)
to cause something to stop working in the usual or expected way: Fears about Japan roiled world financial markets last week. The immigration debate has roiled the country for more than a year.
